author: andreas
content:
I think that's something that already happens. Even on the industrial scale of, say, a Rolling Stones Tour, merchandising makes increasingly more money, and people are absolutely willing to go and see the concerts.

Or look at David Byrne or Trent Raznor. You can buy their latest albums in shops on CD, but they also sell diogital downloads directly from their websites. And this will go on. Big labels were necessary in the past, but they have ceased to be useful to anybody but themselves. Imagine a 15th century union of scribes trying to suppress the developing printing industry.
